Package org.apache.heron.scheduler.mesos.framework

Class MesosFramework

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.heron.scheduler.mesos.framework.MesosFramework
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.mesos.Scheduler
    public class MesosFramework
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.apache.mesos.Scheduler
    Mesos Framework, communicating with Mesos Master, to do the actual scheduling. We put synchronized block: ``` synchronized(this) {...} ``` in critical areas for public methods potentially modifying its value. Make sure not acquiring other locks inside this block to prevent the potential for deadlock.

      • waitForRegistered

        public boolean waitForRegistered​(long timeout,
                                 java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Causes the current thread to wait for MesosFramework got registered, unless the thread is interrupted, or the specified waiting time elapses.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait
        unit - the time unit of the timeout argument
        Returns:
        true MesosFramework got registered, and false if the waiting time elapsed before the count reached zero

      • handleMesosStatusUpdate

        protected void handleMesosStatusUpdate​(java.lang.String taskId,
                                       org.apache.mesos.Protos.TaskStatus status)
        Handle status update from mesos master 1. It does nothing except logging under states: - TASK_STAGING, - TASK_STARTING, - TASK_RUNNING,

        2. It does severe logging under states: - TASK_FINISHED since heron-executor should be long live in normal production running. This state can occur during DEBUG mode. And we would not consider it as failure.

        3. It considers the task a failure and tries to restart it under states: - TASK_FAILED - TASK_KILLED - TASK_LOST - TASK_ERROR

        Parameters:
        taskId - the taskId of container to handle
        status - the TasksStatus to handle

      • handleMesosFailure

        protected void handleMesosFailure​(java.lang.String taskId)
        Restart a failed task unless exceeding the retires limitation
        Parameters:
        taskId - the taskId of container to handle
